events.name: Data In Power - NYC Event
events.description: â€‹Data and the distribution of decision-making power is an increasingly important dynamic to understand and engage with in climate and energy. Who is collecting, analyzing, and presenting data - how and why? These are the hard-hitting questions we will unpack.â€‹Our format features focused discussion and open networking, providing a unique opportunity to dive deep into what data and the distribution of power means to the climate and energy community.Our March meetup will discuss Data In Power initiatives, which include data preservation and the development of decision-making tools.Here is avideowith some background on Data In Power's focus within data and the distribution of decision-making power.â€‹â€‹Data In Power is an independently run meetup without any bells and whistles.In order to maintain community and continue organic growth, prospective attendees should be prepared to support our meetup venue with a purchase, regardless of how large or small. Data In Power brings folks together through meaningful, productive, and unique programming.

events.name: 106th NY Hardware Meetup @ Cornell Tech
events.description: â€‹The Hardware Meetup community is excited to announce the 106th NY Hardware Meetup at Cornell Techâ€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹Hardware Meetups happen across 30+ cities around the world, bringing together hardware professionals to network and learn from each other. You might not realize it, but NYC is a hotbed for this kind of innovation and tonight you'll meet two companies working at the cutting edge of this technology.â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹This month we'll be atCornell Tech. Cornell Tech is  Cornell Universityâ€™s state-of-the-art campus in New York City that develops leaders and technologies for the AI era through foundational and applied research, graduate education, and new ventures. Located on Roosevelt Island, the growing campus was founded in partnership with the Technion-Israel Institute of Technology and in close collaboration with the NYC Economic Development Corporation after Cornell won a worldwide competition initiated by Mayor Michael R. Bloombergâ€™s administration to create an applied sciences campus in New York City. More than 1,000 Cornell students are now educated annually on the campus, including 700 in Cornell Tech programs. Since opening in 2012, nearly 120 new companies have spun out from startup programs at Cornell Tech, and 95 percent of them are based in New York City. Cornell Tech continues to have atransformative economic impact on the regionâ€™s tech sector.â€‹â€‹â€‹AGENDAâ€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹6:30 - Arrival, mingle, grab refreshmentsâ€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹7:00 - Welcome and introductionâ€‹â€‹7:15- Panel with audience Q+Aâ€‹â€‹8:20 - Community open micâ€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹Anyone will have the chance or talk about what they are working on.â€‹â€‹8:30 - Mix + mingleâ€‹â€‹WANT TO GET INVOLVED?â€‹â€‹â€‹Sponsorship:â€‹We offer exclusive access to our 10,000+ member community through sponsorships.â€‹â€‹â€‹Host an event at your space:We are always looking for host sponsors to provide access to unique spaces from cool hardware companies building interesting things. Want to open up your office?â€‹â€‹â€‹Speaker:Do you have something interesting to share with our community? We're on the lookout for fresh faces to talk about their journey and experiences.â€‹â€‹â€‹If you want to get involved, head here:https://linktr.ee/nyhardware

We manufacture locally in NYC, San Francisco, and ship nationwide. Whether a client is looking for a single contractor, a full time employee, or an entire team of professionals to work on everything from product development to go-to-market, informal has the right collection of people for the job. events.description: â€‹UPDATE: This event is sold out! Unfortunately, we don't have a waitlist function, but keep an eye on ourInstagram broadcast channelfor updates in case a spot opens up!â€‹---â€‹Third Place Bar & Shanti Houseinvite to you a different kind of Friday night out. Join us at the Fabrik loft for a relaxing beginner's yoga class, a tea bar, non-alcoholic drinks, live DJ, and playful activities to wind down and de-stress from the week... without the hangover.â€‹What to expect:â€‹6.30pm-7pm: Arrivals & mingling(please make sure to arrive on time before the yoga session!)â€‹7pm-7.45pm: Unwind yin yoga led by Louisa, founder ofShanti Houseâ€‹7.45pm-9:00pm: Social hour with NA drinksâ€‹Stop by the tea bar byNoah Wellness, enjoy some light bites fromHappy Boards, and functional non-alcoholic drinks fromGuinep!â€‹DJ Solunawill be mixing all night! Whether itâ€™s ambient soundscapes, soulful grooves, or energetic afrohouse beats, Soluna crafts immersive musical journeys that move both body and soul.â€‹FAQâ€‹â€‹Q: Do I need to be there at the exact start time?Yes, please aim to arrive at 6.30pm as we will get started with the yoga class at 7pm and latecomers may not be admitted!â€‹â€‹â€‹Q: Can I come alone?Yes, this is a social mixer, youâ€™re welcome to come alone and meet new people!â€‹â€‹â€‹Q: Is this an alcohol-free venue?Yes, Fabrik is a community space that does not serve alcohol.â€‹â€‹â€‹Q: Is there an age restriction?Yes, all our events are 21+â€‹Q: I've never done yoga, can I still come?The yoga class will be relaxed and suitable for beginners.â€‹Q: Do I need to bring a mat? There are limited changing rooms available.â€‹Q: I need to cancel, can I get a refund for my ticket?Unfortunately, we cannot offer refunds, but you're welcome to pass on your ticket to someone else.â€‹â€‹â€‹Please note: By signing up for this event you agree to receive email communication from us. You can opt out any time.

events.name: Female Founders' Tea Party - #NYTechWeek
events.description: â€‹You are cordially invited to an exclusive Female Founders Tea Party in NYC hosted by Foundess and GenZtea founder, Natalie Neptune.â€‹We are excited to bring an intimate and exceptional group of female founders together for an elegant afternoon of connection and conversation!â€‹The Female Founders Tea Party is a curated private gathering with the goal of building meaningful and powerful relationships among women who are shaping the future of tech. And, of course, share exquisite tea and treats together.â€‹Please RSVP, space is very limited.â€‹A note to guests: No +1sâ€‹Event Details:â€‹ğŸ“… Date: June 5rd (tentative)â€‹â° Time: 3 pm EST (tentative)â€‹ğŸ”’ Venue: Revealed closer to date (Luxury venue in NYC)â€‹Warm regards, GenZtea and the Foundess Teamâ€‹A bit about the hosts:â€‹Foundess (foundess.com) is helping founders build beyond gender boundaries. Since October, we've reached over 30,000 builders with our events and programming across top universities including Stanford, Harvard, and MIT. We've recently hosted the largest gender-equitable accelerator sponsored by Silicon Valley Bank, Anthropic, and Notion with $3M raised from our companies post-program.â€‹â˜… Natalie Neptune - Founder of GenZTea & LinkedIn Top Voice Natalie Neptune is the visionary founder behind GenZtea. Since September, she has had over 1,000 Gen Z founders, creators, and investors along with female founders & investor attend IRL events. Sponsored by Kiehl's and partnerships with Daily Crunch, GrÃ¼ns, Beny Yogurt, Columbia Healthcare Ventures, and La Creme de la STEM. As a recognized LinkedIn Top Voice, Natalie shares insights on building sustainable businesses and fostering authentic community engagement.â€‹A note to prospective guests: This tea party is exclusively for female founders who have raised $1M+ or achieved Series A funding and beyond. Admitted guests will be notified via event approval and calendar invite. Invites are non-transferable.â€‹No +1s allowed as space is limited and the gathering is carefully curated. Additional correspondence will be sent leading up to the event.â€‹Code of Conductâ€‹What makes our community special is how we:â€‹Support each other's journeys with authenticity and graceâ€‹Create space for meaningful connection and collaborationâ€‹Share experiences and insights with generosityâ€‹Celebrate each other's successes and provide support during challengesâ€‹Foster an environment of inclusion and belongingâ€‹Uphold the highest standards of professionalism and respectâ€‹The thing we most value is connecting exceptional founders who lead with integrity and vision.â€‹As a guest for the afternoon, you agree to uphold these values.â€‹By providing your information you agree to be added to our email distribution list and contacted by sponsors. You can unsubscribe anytime.â€‹This event is a part of #NYTechWeekâ€”a week of events hosted by VCs and startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more atwww.tech-week.com.

events.name: GenZtea x Boss Me In: Gen Z Founder Match at Chief
events.description: â€‹Join a handpicked cohort of visionary Gen Z female founders for an intimate evening with members of Chief - the most exclusive private network for women executives at the VP and C-suite level, whose members lead organizations valued at over $800 billion collectively.â€‹About the Event:â€‹In Chief's prestigious Manhattan clubhouse, where membership is by invitation-only and has a waitlist of thousands, 20 carefully selected Gen Z female founders will have the opportunity to connect one-on-one with some of business's most influential women leaders. This meticulously curated evening brings together today's Fortune 500 executives with tomorrow's groundbreaking entrepreneurs.â€‹Who Will Be There:â€‹- 20 Selected Gen Z Female Foundersâ€‹- 20 Chief Members (Women executives from Director to C-suite level at Fortune 500 companies, fastest-growing startups, and globally recognized brands)â€‹About the Hosts:â€‹Chief is the most coveted private membership network for senior women executives, with an acceptance rate lower than Harvard. Members include executives from companies like Google, Nike, Goldman Sachs, and other industry-defining organizations. Chief's highly vetted community represents the upper echelon of business leadership, with membership limited to executives at the highest levels of organizational influence.â€‹Boss Me In is pioneering the future of intergenerational leadership, bridging the expertise gap between seasoned executives and emerging leaders through carefully curated connections and transformative experiences.â€‹GenZtea, spanning 21 countries, represents the elite network of Gen Z founders, creators, and investors shaping tomorrow's business landscape. Their partnerships with prestigious institutions and luxury brands like Pace University and Kiehl's showcase their commitment to elevating the next generation of business leaders.â€‹This is a once-in-a-career opportunity to join an evening of unparalleled access and connection.â€‹[Apply Now - Limited to 20 Gen Z Founders]â€‹Location: Chief's Private Members' Club, NYCâ€‹Due to the highly exclusive nature of this event, applications will undergo a rigorous review process. Selected participants will represent the most promising ventures and innovative thinking in their respective industries.

events.name: aci-d trip : The Lubalin Archives
events.description: â€‹Update:Weâ€™re sold out! Weâ€™ll likely do a second tour in April or May. Follow ourInstagramor subscribe to our luma calendar to hear about the announcement!â€‹â€”â€”â€‹Join us for a visit to the Lubalin Archives at The Cooper Union.The Lubalin Center preserves the work of Herb Lubalin and other designers through an archive that includes drawings, type specimens, posters, logos, and advertising materials. Lubalin is a goated American Graphic Designer and this growing archive contain works not only by him but also Paul Rand, Milton Glaser, Massimo Vignelli, and many others.â€‹The archive isnâ€™t digitized so you literally wonâ€™t be able to find its stuff on are.na, Pinterest, google images etc. Weâ€™re moving beyond aesthetics and engaging with materiality and context, folks! As someone who has visited the archives, Iâ€™d say it contains some of the best design references in the country.â€‹Weâ€™re getting a hands-on presentation of a selection of material which lasts about an hour and a half. It's a closer look at some of the objects in the collection, the stories behind them, and what they can teach us about making work today. The emphasis is on ways we can make active use of design history as contemporary practitioners. The curators will use physical examples from the collection to construct specific case studies of ways we can look at objects to inform today's design decisions.â€‹The Center usually doesnâ€™t host groups past 3 PM, but theyâ€™ve graciously agreed to keep the archive open for us until 6 PM on Friday, allowing for a 4 PM start. You may need to leave work a little early, but itâ€™s a Friday and well worth it.
